conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to calculate the change in magnetic flux passing through the coil as it rotates 60 degrees downward around the z-axis.
The magnetic flux is given by the product of the magnetic induction intensity and the area of the coil.
The coil ABCO is a rectangle with vertices A, B, C, and O, and it rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
The distance from point A to point B along the x-axis is 0.5 meters.
The distance from point B to point C along the y-axis is 0.5 meters.
The area of the coil ABCO is calculated as A = l × w = 0.5 × 0.5 = 0.25 m².
The magnetic induction intensity is given as B = 0.1 T.
The change in magnetic flux is calculated as ΔΦ = B × A = 0.1 × 0.25 = 0.025 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux passing through the coil is 0.025 Webers.
